body.p:
Sherburne Ky. Aug. 10 1865
To His Excellency Gov. Bramlet
Frankfort Ky.
Dear Sir -- :

We the undersigned citizens of Bath and Fleming countes do aske of you the release of Frederic Green for a few dayes; who whilst intoxicated committed a breack of the peace in Fleming Co. Ky. and was arrested by the civil authorites here tryed before a lawful and impartial Jurors and convicted to twenty days imprisenment. Now the resans of our requests are these 1st
1st In consequence of his wifes illness which is very greate and casideraly ammaciating under grief.

2d No one to take of here in the right maner. Furthermore he is poor and cant be relieve with out the help of your gereous hands and we aske you through a spirit of humanity and christianity to casider the misfortuns of the afflicted and extend & help in time of need.

John Raley J, P,
J. M. Williams (Juror)
N. H. McNew Physician to wife
